TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit MessageReceiver extends Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.ClientEntity

Docs.summary: The MessageReceiver class is used to receive messages from the message container and acknowledge them.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Abandon (Guid lockToken);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Abandon(valuetype System.Guid lockToken) cil managed

Docs.param: The lock token bound to the locked message instance to abandon.
Docs.summary: Discards the message and relinquishes the message lock ownership.
Docs.remarks: When the message receiver fails to get the message from the queue/topic, this method should be called. The Service Bus will increment the delivery count of the message. The message receiver now can either attempt to receive the message again or move it to the dead-letter queue.

The properties to modify.
Docs.summary: Discards the message and relinquishes the message lock ownership.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual TimeSpan BatchFlushInterval { get; }
.property instance valuetype System.TimeSpan BatchFlushInterval

Docs.summary: Gets the batch flush interval.
Docs.value: The batch flush interval. The default value is 20 ms.
Docs.remarks: You can set the value of it via SbmpTransportSetting.BatchFlushInterval

MemberSignature.Value: protected bool BatchingEnabled { get; }
.property instance bool BatchingEnabled

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the batching is enabled.
Docs.value: true if batching is enabled; otherwise, false.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Complete (Guid lockToken);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Complete(valuetype System.Guid lockToken) cil managed

Docs.param: The lock token of the . This is only available when a message is received in peek-lock mode. The lock token is used internally to complete or abandon a message.
Docs.summary: Completes the receive operation on a message. If using AMQP, this operation can only be performed on messages that were received by this receiver.
Docs.remarks: This method is used as a handshake between the receiver and Service Bus for a guaranteed delivery of the message. If the receiver failed before calling this method, the message will be kept in the queue.

Docs.param: The lock token.
Docs.summary: Asynchronously completes the receive operation on a message. If using AMQP, this operation can only be performed on messages that were received by this receiver.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Defer (Guid lockToken);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Defer(valuetype System.Guid lockToken) cil managed

Docs.param: The lock token of the . This is only available when a message is received in peek-lock mode. The lock token is used internally to complete or abandon a message.
Docs.summary: Indicates that the receiver wants to defer the processing for the message.
Docs.remarks: Before deferring user should set aside the message receipt for later retrieval.
